Name: Requiring containers for foods packaged on premises to be made of recyclable material.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring  containers for foods packaged on premises to be made of recyclable material.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
	
Section 1.  Chapter 3 of title 16 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 16-310.1 to read as follows:
	Sec. 16-310.1  Food containers.  All establishments which sell food in the city shall only use or offer for use containers for packaging food composed of a material that has been designated as a recyclable by the commissioner pursuant to section 16-314 of this chapter, where foods are packaged (a) on the premises of the establishment where they are sold; or (b) in a manner determined by an entity situated in the city.
Â§2. This local law shall take effect on January 1, 2010.


LS#5023
JH    9-3-09
